name: KING'S INDIAN ATTACK
idea: The universal attacking system for White! With Nf3, g3, Bg2, 0-0, d3, e4, Nbd2, White builds a solid setup that works against almost any Black response. The plan is simple: once developed, push e4-e5 or f2-f4-f5 to attack the kingside. It's the perfect opening for players who want to avoid theory and play their favorite positions. Fischer used it to crush strong opponents!
errors_white: Playing too slowly: once developed, the attack must start with e5 or f4
Forgetting the center: e4 is important, don't let Black play ...d4
Ignoring Black's counterplay: ...c5 and ...b5 can be annoying
errors_black: Being too passive: ...d5, ...c5 must fight for space
Ignoring the kingside attack: ...h6 can be useful to prevent Bg5
Castling kingside into the attack: sometimes queenside castle is better
development: Nf3 is always the first move - flexible and solid
g3 then Bg2 - the fianchetto controls the long diagonal and center from afar
0-0 quickly to secure the King and activate the f1 Rook
Supports e4 and keeps a flexible structure - NOT d4 at the start
Nbd2 supports e4 and can go to f1-e3 or h3 for the attack
The thematic move! After preparation, e4 opens the game for the Bg2

traps.name: Attack Trap
traps.desc: Typical position. White prepares e5 with Qe2, h3, then e5! If ...Nfd7 f4-f5 opens lines for a deadly attack. AVOID (Black): Play ...dxe4 dxe4 ...e5 to block the advance.

traps.name: Closed Center Trap
traps.desc: After e5 Nfd7 f4, White aims for f5! Opening the f-file will be devastating for the Black King. AVOID (Black): Play ...f6 or ...f5 to block White's pawn advance.

traps.name: Fianchetto Trap
traps.desc: If Black plays ...dxe4?! 5.dxe4 Qxd1+ Rxd1, White has a good middlegame with the active Bg2 and d-file. AVOID (Black): Keep tension in the center, don't exchange on e4.

variants.name: Against the French
variants.uci: e2e4 e7e6 d2d3 d7d5 b1d2 g8f6 g1f3 b8c6 g2g3
variants.white_plan: Bg2, 0-0, then prepare e5 with Qe2 and Re1. If ...dxe4 dxe4, the center is open for the Bg2.
variants.black_plan: Black can play ...Be7, ...0-0, ...b6/...Bb7 or ...dxe4 followed by ...e5 to block the Bishop.

variants.name: Against the Sicilian
variants.uci: e2e4 c7c5 g1f3 e7e6 d2d3 b8c6 g2g3 d7d5 b1d2
variants.white_plan: Avoid theoretical lines of the Open Sicilian. Bg2, 0-0, then e5 or exd5 depending on position.
variants.black_plan: Black has a strong center with ...d5 and ...c5. Play ...Nge7, ...g6 and look for ...d4 to block the Bg2.

variants.name: Universal System
variants.uci: g1f3 d7d5 g2g3 g8f6 f1g2 c7c6 e1g1 c8g4 d2d3
variants.white_plan: Flexible structure. Nbd2, e4 when ready, then depending on Black's response: h3 (chases the Bishop) or Qe2 and e5.
variants.black_plan: ...Bg4 pins the Knight before e4. Play ...Nbd7, ...e6, ...Be7 then ...0-0 with a solid position.
